page.title: 10Farming in the Sorbie Area
page.content: Our area is mainly{farming},and includes 11 farmsThe majority of these farms are milk producing {dairy}farms, with some arable land for growing { {crops.}The sizes of farms range from 70 to 520 acres. There are three beef farms, and only one farm keeps pigs, which are reared for fattening and selling to butchers and {markets}.One farm keeps donkeys and another breeds Clydesdale horses. The Clydesdale horses are bred to be put on display at agricultural shows. In the past they were used to pull farm implements The various crops that the farmers grow are turnips, barley, kale, silage and hay. These crops are used to feed the animals in the winter time. Seven of these farms keep sheep - from as few as 19 to as many as 250. The sheep are bred for fattening, and also for the production of wool.
